metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday and Second Sunday After Pentecost

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Paul's emotional state in 2 Corinthians and the liturgical history of Psalm 130. Focus on the 'depths' of sin and the 'fullness' of the Trinitarian blessing.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong historical-critical and liturgical context provided.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's love and the reality of human sin, with a concluding shift toward blessing.
voorbeelden: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
This is no dry scholarly doctrine.
The fear of the Lord is founded on his absolute goodness.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort through the realization of God's persistence; humility through the recognition of sin.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit in the text of the blessing, but the sermon lacks an explicit invocation of the Spirit's current agency in the preaching event.

voorbeelden: The Corinthian church has gone completely off the rails.
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
God pursues us even beyond the grave.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. Promises are often quoted as biblical facts rather than direct addresses from God to the hearer.

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High in the benediction, but the body of the sermon remains largely descriptive.

indicatoren: Historical analysis of the Book of Common Prayer revisions.
Third-person descriptions of God's nature ('The inmost being of God is...').
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer learns a great deal about the theology of the Trinity and Sin, but may feel like a spectator to a lecture rather than a participant in an encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise ('God promises YOU')

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong when it occurs, but often mediated through the 'Apostolic Blessing' as a liturgical quote.
voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord... be with you all.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used to prompt reflection ('Think of your life') and in the final blessing.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode: talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and the nature of God.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Systematic theological truths about God's nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate moment of blessing and prayer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Nature of God/Sin) to a final Commissive/Declarative (Blessing).
voorbeelden: This is the love... And so I may leave you today... invoking the blessing.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but the 'Toezegging' (Promise) is delayed until the very end.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: With the Lord there is mercy... therefore you shall be feared.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological exposition that remains largely in the realm of 'talking about' God until the final liturgical act.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The last four chapters of 2 Corinthians form the most agonized portion...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much time spent on historical/literary description.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final paragraph, but the journey there is primarily educational.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon explains the sacrament of the Word better than it performs it.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the object of the sermon more than the subject speaking through it.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as an expert interpreter of the text.
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul was not being perfunctory after all.
Here we begin to move into the heart of the Trinity.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as a member of the Trinity, but less as the agent of the current preaching.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's reflection.
tekstueel_bewijs: The fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon points toward the means of grace (the blessing).
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strongest in the descriptions of God's 'full radiance'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God spends His love on you, down to the last drop of His Son's blood.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a personal address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are cited as 'Biblical passages' rather than delivered as 'God's Word for you'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the second person to deliver the promise mid-sermon.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because there is forgiveness with Him, you are released from your depths right now.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Bridge the gap between Paul's desperation and the hearer's desperation more directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like the Corinthians, you may feel off the rails, but the grace of Christ is reaching for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, just needs more performative force.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically profound and beautifully written; increasing the direct illocutionary force will transform this from a great lecture into a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'; SAT focuses on whether the words actually 'do' the grace they describe.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer of the Trinity's beauty; SAT seeks to enact the Trinity's blessing.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final benediction, while the body of the sermon is 'preparatory locution'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
The last four chapters of 2 Corinthians form the most agonized portion of the New Testament.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Informative but stays in 'talking about' mode.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly liturgical and relies on the final blessing to carry the performative weight.
